trans-unit.source: Creates collections that ignore the case in strings.
These methods generate a case-insensitive instance of the collection using case-insensitive implementations of the hash code provider and the comparer.
The resulting instance can be used like any other instances of that class, although it may behave differently.
For example, suppose two objects with the keys "hello" and "HELLO" are to be added to a hash table.
A case-sensitive hash table would create two different entries; whereas, a case-insensitive hash table would throw an exception when adding the second object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.CollectionsUtil"></xref> class.
Creates a new case-insensitive instance of the <xref href="System.Collections.Hashtable"></xref> class with the default initial capacity.

Instead of using the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.CollectionsUtil.CreateCaseInsensitiveHashtable%2A> method, use the <xref:System.Collections.Hashtable.%23ctor%28System.Collections.IEqualityComparer%29?displayProperty=fullName> constructor to create a case-insensitive <xref:System.Collections.Hashtable> class.
A new case-insensitive instance of the <xref href="System.Collections.Hashtable"></xref> class with the default initial capacity.

Copies the entries from the specified dictionary to a new case-insensitive instance of the <xref href="System.Collections.Hashtable"></xref> class with the same initial capacity as the number of entries copied.

Instead of using the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.CollectionsUtil.CreateCaseInsensitiveHashtable%2A> method, use the <xref:System.Collections.Hashtable.%23ctor%28System.Collections.IDictionary%2CSystem.Collections.IEqualityComparer%29?displayProperty=fullName> constructor to create a case-insensitive <xref:System.Collections.Hashtable> class.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> to copy to a new case-insensitive <xref href="System.Collections.Hashtable"></xref>.
A new case-insensitive instance of the <xref href="System.Collections.Hashtable"></xref> class containing the entries from the specified <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref>.
d is `null`.
Creates a new case-insensitive instance of the <xref href="System.Collections.Hashtable"></xref> class with the specified initial capacity.

Instead of using the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.CollectionsUtil.CreateCaseInsensitiveHashtable%2A> method, use the <xref:System.Collections.Hashtable.%23ctor%28System.Int32%2CSystem.Collections.IEqualityComparer%29?displayProperty=fullName> constructor to create a case-insensitive <xref:System.Collections.Hashtable> class.
The approximate number of entries that the <xref href="System.Collections.Hashtable"></xref> can initially contain.
A new case-insensitive instance of the <xref href="System.Collections.Hashtable"></xref> class with the specified initial capacity.
capacity is less than zero.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Collections.SortedList"></xref> class that ignores the case of strings.
The new <xref:System.Collections.SortedList> instance is sorted according to the <xref:System.Collections.CaseInsensitiveComparer>.
A new instance of the <xref href="System.Collections.SortedList"></xref> class that ignores the case of strings.
